name: require-on-rails
description: A Roblox Luau utility extension to simplify working with complex codebase hierarchies

require-on-rails.startsImmediately.description: Whether to start the extension as soon as vscode finishes loading.

require-on-rails.tryToAddImportRequire.description: Whether or not the system will try to add the contextual import generator statement automatically when you open a file that is missing it.

require-on-rails.enableAbsolutePathUpdat.description: Whether to prompt for updating absolute require paths when files are moved between different alias directories.

require-on-rails.enableCollisionDetectio.description: Whether to detect and handle filename collisions by automatically renaming files with '_Duplicate' suffix.

require-on-rails.enableBasenameUpdates.description: Whether to prompt for updating basename require statements when files are renamed.

require-on-rails.importOpacity.description: The opacity of the require override in the editor. Ex: `require = require('@Import')`

require-on-rails.importModulePaths.description: The valid values for the `require` override. This is used to generate the contextual import statements. Uses the first value in the array as the default import path if one is not found.

require-on-rails.directoriesToScan.description: Directories to scan for generating Luau file aliases. Relative to the workspace root.

require-on-rails.ignoreDirectories.description: Regex patterns for directories/files to ignore when scanning for Luau files to generate aliases. By default uses '^_.*' to ignore anything prefixed with an underscore.

require-on-rails.supportedExtensions.description: File extensions to consider when generating Luau file aliases and updating require statements. (Do not touch)

require-on-rails.requirePrefix.description: The prefix character used in require statements (e.g., '@' for require('@ModuleName')). (Do not touch)

scripts.compile: echo 'No compilation needed for vanilla JS'
